title: Matt Toomua ribs Leicester team-mates ahead of England's World Cup quarter-final against Australia
text:
Matt Toomua jokingly sledged his former Leicester Tigers team-mates ahead of England v Australia - before warning the Wallabies about Manu Tuilagi.

Asked by Sportsmail about his England mates George Ford, Jonny May, Ben Youngs, Dan Cole and Tuilagi, the ex-Tigers playmaker said with tongue firmly in cheek: 'I know all their weaknesses.

'Manu is a terrible snooker player, George Ford never pays for a beer, Ben Youngs isn't even the best rugby player in his family, the chicken Jonny May is very weird and Dan Cole doesn't have a personality!

Matt Toomua has helped Australia stay unbeaten on their path to the World Cup quarter-finals

Ben Youngs' brother, Tom, also plays for Leicester, while Toomua has called George Ford stingy

'No, I have a great relationship with them and they're all quality players. We were fortunate for the last couple of years when Manu came back from injury, we just saw him grow in stature.

'He probably grows the bigger the game as well.

'He probably plays his best rugby in Tests, and that's the sign of a true champion player.

Toomua has identified Leicester team-mate Manu Tuilagi as a player for Australia to be wary of

'Obviously Manu is a name that sticks out for a lot of reasons - he is a strong carrier and makes a lot of big plays. But it is probably trying to shut down his time and space.

'He is at 12 now so he is a bit closer to the play, so it might be a little easier in that sense. I'm sure they're working out ways to give him some ball one-on-one at full steam.'
description: Asked by Sportsmail about his England mates George Ford, Jonny May, Ben Youngs, Dan Cole and Manu Tuilagi, the ex-Tigers playmaker said: 'I know all their weaknesses.'
